docs: we got it working for a while until we got back the next night .it was outdated yet clean , and small .while on business / vacation we stayed at the lake louise inn and found it to be a beautiful property ; the grounds were well manicured , our room was on the 1 st floor with at the door parking , the suite ( bedroom , bath , kitchenette and seating with fireplace ) were spotless , upgraded and had a beautiful view of the woods behind us .we had a two queen room that was clean , but rather dark , very noisy with very dated furnishings .rooms were clean . </DOC> our room was clean and ample for one nights stay , there was laundry facilities in the accommodation block that we were in .its clean and comfortable enough but basically a motel and not worth the rates they charge ( no doubt with a hearty laugh ) in the summer peak </DOC> not all rooms are the same so book carefully .this is by no means anything but a basic hotel .the room was clean and in decent condtion .and it ’s impossible to watch tv if someone is in the bed .the unit was clean but showed signs of wear . </DOC> the room was clean but very tight and thin walls .despite having booked a two bedroom , two bathroom family apartment that could cater and accept the 4 adults and 3 children , something sure was missing .the microwave was all in french .......the ' murphy bed ' ( pull out divan ) was to sleep a teenage girl .but the springs were broken , and she had to sleep on a thin mattress on the floor . </DOC> however , our standard room ( in a separate building called the " pinery " ) was awful - cramped , dated and dark , and so poorly soundproofed that i could have joined in with next door 's conversation .our room was reached by four shabby , external flights of stairs .it was clean enough and the staff were friendly , but i was very relieved to check out after two nights .on the positive side , the room was clean and the bed fairly comfortable if not what you 'd call top tier .i found it insufficiently firm . </DOC> and we were tired .the linens were clean and looked nice .however , the hot tub and pool were clean .the room was very clean and well keptin addition , the bedclothes looked as though they had just been hurriedly and carelessly pulled up rather than being properly smoothed and re - made properly . </DOC> the escalator and entrance was awfully sub standard .however , the accommodation was still in need of updatingthe rooms were clean and well maintained as was the rest of the hotel andwe were on the top floor .even the first floor rooms of bldg 4 are up one flight of stairs . </DOC> , i know all three of us wet our socks on more than one time .the room was clean and quiet .the room had a odor .we did sleep very well , but beware of the corners ., firstly the good news , the room was clean and well appointed
